channel.title: Comments on: Half Full Activity – Results and Debrief
channel.description: iteration, making, building, and coding in education

item.title: By: Evan
item.dc:creator: Evan
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2013/07/10/half-full-activity-results-and-debrief/#comment-213">xiousgeonz</a>.
Really neat idea. It's possible, but will require some more learning these tools to actually make it happen.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to xiousgeonz.

Really neat idea. It’s possible, but will require some more learning these tools to actually make it happen.

item.title: By: xiousgeonz
item.dc:creator: xiousgeonz
item.description: Another question: how hard would it be to make an app so students drag numbers to a number line, and it figures out ( or shows 'em, as you did with the dragginess) how close they were to the right spot?
item.content:encoded: Another question: how hard would it be to make an app so students drag numbers to a number line, and it figures out ( or shows ’em, as you did with the dragginess) how close they were to the right spot?

item.title: By: xiousgeonz
item.dc:creator: xiousgeonz
item.description: But... when will we use this in real life?
item.content:encoded: But… when will we use this in real life?

item.title: By: xiousgeonz
item.dc:creator: xiousgeonz
item.description: Excellent point, Dad. I remember talking fractions to sixth graders, and Pat O'Brien knew what a third was. Nobody else did.
item.content:encoded: Excellent point, Dad. I remember talking fractions to sixth graders, and Pat O’Brien knew what a third was. Nobody else did.

item.title: By: Dad
item.dc:creator: Dad
item.description: Estimating graphically where the factor is other than a multiple of 2 is non-trivial. I don;t think the mind works that way, that is where math would be needed. I can do thirds on regular shapes, but mostly rectangles. -Dad
item.content:encoded:
Estimating graphically where the factor is other than a multiple of 2 is non-trivial. I don;t think the mind works that way, that is where math would be needed. I can do thirds on regular shapes, but mostly rectangles.
-Dad
